bibl.title: Letter from Mark F. Boyd to Henry Rose Carter, April 14, 1924

div1.p: Boyd refers to two excerpts from Goeldis' theory on the African origin of Stegomyia fasciata.

div1.head: Letter from Mark F. Boyd to Henry Rose Carter, April 14, 1924
div1.opener:
TELEPHONE, NORTE 3119
RUA TENENTE POSSOLO, 39
CONSELHO SANITARIO INTERNACIONAL
COMMISSÃO ROCKEFELLER
RIO DE JANEIRO, BRAZIL
CAIXA POSTAL NUMERO 49
TELEGRAMMAS, INTERCOM RIO
Rio de Janeiro, April 14, 1924.
Dr. H. R. Carter
2121 California St.,
Washington D. C.
Dear Dr. Carter:
div1.p:
At the request of Dr. Joseph H. White, I
am enclosing two excerpts from Goeldis “Os Mosquitos do Pa-
rá” expressing Goeldis opinion on the African origin of
Stegomyia fasciata. I have not translated these, but if
you desire will furnish a translation.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours Mark F. Boyd, Director
Field Studies of Malaria in Brasil.
